text: [Music]
hello this is chef John for food wishes
comm with a spicy orange bison balls
little cocktail meatballs in a delicious
spicy orange sauce inspired by the retro
order of classic little cocktail
meatballs and grape jelly but these are
done with ground bison here it is tender
bison all-natural bison normally doesn't
contain any hormones any antibiotics
things like that so really nice product
works really well in this recipe alright
so this is a one-pound package I'm gonna
add a couple cloves of garlic some black
pepper salt
alright crack one egg some wish asure
sauce some breadcrumb and I'm gonna mix
this up and I'm not using my hands cuz I
gotta work the camera you don't want
bison ball mixture all over your camera
and worried about here I was like man my
hands getting really sore from trying to
use a fork so I switched to a nice heavy
wooden spoon
alright mix it well don't worry about
over mixing alright so I'm gonna use a
little sorbet scoop here a little ice
cream scoop to make nice uniform bison
balls I gotta roll them so they're nice
and smooth which will help when I Brown
them alright you're gonna get about 24
small little meat balls out of this
batch all right over to the stove in a
saute pan over a medium heat a little
bit of oil and a game I like to play I
actually stand on the other side of the
kitchen and throw them in the pan to see
if I can make it which I did everyone so
you're gonna brown those over medium
heat till they're nicely browned on all
sides as they say then we're gonna get
our sauce ready so I'm gonna add a good
amount of hot chili sauce this is sambal
which I use a lot you can use regular
chili sauce you just have to probably
spice it up a little more so if you just
want to use your regular basic
supermarket chili sauce you might have
to add some cayenne or some red pepper
flakes I'm gonna put a half a cup of
orange marmalade I like the kind of has
the zest in it you don't have to use
that kind you can use just the orange
jelly some soy sauce for a little salt
alright we're gonna need some rice
vinegar and then water alright now I
should have or I could have transferred
this to a sauce pan so that the
meatballs were covered and they'd
simmered it for like an hour which I'm
gonna do here but I couldn't be bothered
to dirty another pan and this one's
already had the meatballs in it so what
I'm gonna do is I'm gonna take these
bison balls and just simmer them in the
sauce for an hour just turn them every
once in a while keeping it like a low
simmer alright you want these to absorb
all those be
orange spicy flavors so you want to
assemble these for at least an hour if
you need to add more water add more
water but what's gonna happen it's gonna
reduce it's gonna thicken and look at
that beautiful spicy orange sauce so
delicious and so perfect with the
Buffalo all right I'm just gonna keep
spooning this over it's still reducing I
have it on low just keep basting the
bison balls until they're just perfectly
glazed shiny and delicious all right
you're gonna taste give another little
shot of soy sauce if you think it needs
it and that's ready to serve now you can
serve this as a main course over some
rice it would be very lovely but really
these are great for hors d'oeuvre at a
cocktail party put a thing of toothpicks
next to it people will love this by the
way that sauce is great if you like
orange beef or orange pork orange
chicken grill off or sear off some meat
make that same glaze reduce it brush it
on the meat you have a great great spicy
orange sauce and there you go spicy
orange bison balls and make sure you
make enough of these if you run out
people will get testy and if you haven't
given bison aka buffalo meat a try this
is a great dish to try it it's very good
for you it's in every supermarket now
check it out if you need the ingredients
go to the website and as always enjoy
you
